Title: The Hobbit
Summary:
Bilbo Baggins is whisked from his quiet life by a band of dwarves and the wizard Gandalf. On a quest to reclaim a lost kingdom, he faces trolls, goblins, spiders, and a dragon. Along the road he discovers courage he never knew he had.
Themes: friendship; adventure; courage; homecoming

Winston Smith struggles for truth and individuality under a totalitarian regime that rewrites reality. His secret love affair becomes an act of rebellion. Surveillance and propaganda close in as he searches for freedom of thought.
Themes: oppression; surveillance; truth vs. lies; individuality

Title: To Kill a Mockingbird
Summary:
Young Scout Finch observes her father defend a Black man falsely accused in a segregated Southern town. Through childhood adventures and courtroom drama, she confronts injustice. Compassion becomes her compass in a divided community.
Themes: justice; empathy; racism; moral growth

Title: Dune
Summary:
Paul Atreides is thrust into a desert world where politics, prophecy, and ecology collide. As rival houses fight for control of spice, he learns the ways of the Fremen. Destiny reshapes him—and the future of the empire.
Themes: power; ecology; destiny; religion; survival

Title: The Name of the Wind
Summary:
Kvothe recounts his life—from orphaned street urchin to gifted student at a school of magic. He hunts for the truth behind a legendary tragedy. Music, wit, and obsession guide his rise and missteps.
Themes: storytelling; identity; knowledge; ambition

Title: The Girl with the Dragon Tattoo
Summary:
Journalist Mikael Blomkvist and hacker Lisbeth Salander investigate a decades-old disappearance. Their pursuit uncovers corporate corruption and buried violence. Two uncommon allies learn to trust each other.
Themes: justice; corruption; trauma; partnership

Title: The Ocean at the End of the Lane
Summary:
A man revisits his childhood and a neighbor family with uncanny powers. Memory opens a door to ancient forces and quiet heroism. Wonder and fear mingle in a tale about what we keep and what we forget.
Themes: memory; innocence; sacrifice; the supernatural

Title: Neuromancer
Summary:
Washed-up hacker Case is hired for one last job in a neon-soaked future. He dives through cyberspace with a volatile partner and an AI with its own agenda. Reality blurs as he races against corporate and digital ghosts.
Themes: technology; consciousness; freedom; alienation

Title: The Night Circus
Summary:
Two young magicians are bound to a duel staged within a mysterious, midnight circus. As love blooms, the game’s rules turn dangerous. The performers’ fates entwine beneath tents of wonder and shadow.
Themes: love; rivalry; destiny; imagination

Title: The Overstory
Summary:
Strangers’ lives intersect through their ties to trees and forests. Their choices ripple across decades, confronting exploitation and awe. The natural world becomes both character and cause.
Themes: nature; interconnectedness; activism; survival
